thinking.disposable_income: Greater Greenspoint has a relatively low median household income around $35,000, with many residents living below the poverty line and facing significant financial constraints.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Residents have limited discretionary spending capacity, with a high proportion of income going to essential needs like housing and transportation.
thinking.accessibility: The area has moderate transit access with bus services but many residents rely on personal vehicles due to dispersed job locations and limited transit coverage.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritized lower transit fares ($0.75) to help low-income residents who depend on transit. 2. Favored moderate sales tax (1%) to balance transit funding with impact on limited disposable income. 3. Supported moderate driving fees ($0.50) to improve transit without overly burdening car-dependent workers. 4. Selected policies that reduce transit travel times to under 57 minutes to improve accessibility. 5. Considered combined cost burden of taxes, fares, and fees on low-income households.
